description: This trap is to communicate a couple of things about
the completion of a file transfer.
mpeDevFileXferStatus - Did it complete successfully or not.
mpeDevFileXferErrorStatus - If not, what was the error code.
mpeDevFileXferOperation - What operation was performed?.
mpeDevFileXferFileType - Was it a firmware xfer or config?
mpeDevFileXferFileName - The name of the file transfered.

Summary.eval: ($v1==3) ? '$v4 file transfer failed with error $v2' : '$v4 file transfer status: $v1'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PDN-MPE-DEVICE-CONTROL-MIB::mpeDevFileXferEvent PDN-MPE-DEVICE-CONTROL-MIB::mpeDevFileXferStatus i 1 PDN-MPE-DEVICE-CONTROL-MIB::mpeDevFileXferErrorStatus i 9999 PDN-MPE-DEVICE-CONTROL-MIB::mpeDevFileXferOperation i 1 PDN-MPE-DEVICE-CONTROL-MIB::mpeDevFileXferFileType i 1 PDN-MPE-DEVICE-CONTROL-MIB::mpeDevFileXferFileName s EXAMPLE

description: This object contains the status of the file transfer.
variables.name: PDN-MPE-DEVICE-CONTROL-MIB::mpeDevFileXferStatus

description: This object contains the reason code of the failure determined in
mpeDevFileXferStatus.
The reason code are specific to the file transfer protocol.
Please refer to the file transfer protocols respective RFC for
clarification
of the error code value meanings.
TFTP Error Codes from rfc 1350
FTP Error Codes from rfc 959
variables.name: PDN-MPE-DEVICE-CONTROL-MIB::mpeDevFileXferErrorStatus

description: This object contains the operation the file transfer wants to
perform.
variables.name: PDN-MPE-DEVICE-CONTROL-MIB::mpeDevFileXferOperation

description: Specifies the type of file your want to transfer.
variables.name: PDN-MPE-DEVICE-CONTROL-MIB::mpeDevFileXferFileType

description: This object contains the name of the filetransfer file.
variables.name: PDN-MPE-DEVICE-CONTROL-MIB::mpeDevFileXferFileName
